comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: Larne (where I have reason to travel to each day) has changed a bit since 1900!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryward] But the name McNeill lives on! So Curran Road is the right location??

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: It is Main Street at that point - it is incorrectly labelled on Google maps!

comment.author: 32699769@N02
comment._content: The large coach would indeed be called a Char-a-bancs (or charabanc in English) the smaller ones are typical Irish jaunting carts.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/henkenmieke] Thanks for the confirmation! Have seen also that Hannah, the housekeeper in Louisa May Alcott's Little Women called it a "Cherry-bounce"... :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: The Charabanc driver must be quite skilled at his job - he has to manage three horses in unison.
